children.name: Team
children.description:
Base - Team 
You can manage and build your own personal battle team in your base. 

Team Structure 
Your battle team consists of three squads. Every squad has one front slot, and two rear slots. Players start with five available slots. 

Additional slots are unlocked as you level. 

Individual character cards take up one slot. However, Combiner's occupy three slots.

Adjust Team 
You can add new members to your team by tapping an empty slot. You can also change your character's squad location by dragging a character card to the new desired slot.

children.name: Combiner
children.description:
Base - Combiner 
Certain Transformers can combine into more powerful Transformers called Combiners. 

Power
The Combiner's power is dependent on the power of the Transformer's used to make him. 

Combiners level up according to the XP gained by its constituent memebers.

Deploy 
A combiner takes up three team slots. Transformers in the HQ, or those that are already in your team, cannot be used as part of a Combiner. 

View Details 
You can view your Combiners by going to the Base and clicking on Combiner.

children.name: Character
children.description:
Base- Character 
The Character section displays all your available characters. Including those in your battle team, and those in your base. 

Develop 
You can increase character stats by clicking on Details, and then clicking on Develop, which is located on the top of the character page. Developing a character will require Dev Cubes, and Cybertickets for more advanced development. 

Promote
You can dramatically increase character stats by promoting a character. The Promote button is located on the same tab as the Develop button. 

Promoting a character uses Starmetal, which can be acquired from boxes, and from using Trial feature of the game. 

Descendant 
You can use the Descendant feature to transfer XP from a higher class character to a lower class character. Using this feature will destroy the character you wish to transfer XP from. However, Starmetal and Dev Cube will be partially returned.

children.name: HQ
children.description:
Base - HQ 
Characters who are not in your battle team can be placed in the HQ. In the HQ there are four different occupations that can be staffed by one character. These occupations provide different passive benefits to your other characters. In addition, the characters you choose to be in your HQ will receive 60% of the battle XP you receive.

children.name: Tech
children.description:
Base - Tech 
Leveling up stats in Tech will add a passive bonus to all other characters.

children.name: Production
children.description:
Base - Production 
Dev. Cubes are produced after a certain period of time. Claiming Dev. Cubes will start the next production cycle.

children.name: Training
children.description:
Base - Training 
You can give characters additional XP by training them.

children.name: Equipment
children.description:
Base - Equipment 
Equipment is used to increase character's stats. 

Type
There are three different types of equipment: Weapon (increases attack), Defense (Increases Defense), and Speed (increases speed). 

Each weapon has five classes: D, C, B, A, and S. S is the most powerful.

Enhance
You can enhance your equipment by using credits. Enhancing your equipment increases both its level and its strength.

children.name: Ability
children.description:
Base - Ability 
Characters can equip abilities to increase their power, improve performance in combat, and provide bonuses to other functions in the base. 

Type
There are two types of abilities, battle abilities, and production abilities. Battle abilities assist character's performance in combat, and production abilities provide bonuses for production in your base. 

Each character can equip two abilities. 

Abilities have five class levels: D, C, B, A, and S. 

Level Up
You can level up abilities by consuming other abilities you acquire.

children.name: Chip
children.description:
Base - Chip 
Characters can increase their stats by equipping Chips. 

Chip Slot
Chip Slots will be unlocked as characters level. At most, characters can equip eight chips. 

Merge
Chips of the same type can be merged in order to increase the Chip's rank.

children.name: Cyberkey
children.description:
Base - Cyberkey 
Cyberkeys can be used to create new characters. 

Required number of keys to merge 
Cyberkeys of the same kind can be merged to create new characters. Characters have different numbers of required cyberkeys. 

Exchange 
Cyberkeys can also be exchanged for Dark Cyberkeys, which can be used to purchase items on the black market. Higher class Cyberkeys produce more Dark Cyberkeys when exchanged.

children.name: Item
children.description:
Base - Item Inventory
Various acquired Items are stored in the Item Inventory. You can view the details of these items here.

children.name: Evolve
children.description:
Base - Evolve 
Character's classes can be raised by using Evolve.

children.name: Lab
children.description:
Base - Lab
You can increase the class of your equipment, and merge materials in the Base's Lab.

children.name: Campaign
children.description:
Battle - Story 
The Story mode is based on the Transformer's Generation One animated series. 

Difficulties 
There are three different difficulties for campaign: Normal, Elite, and Hero. Players will first have to complete Normal mode on one chapter before they can unlock Elite mode for that chapter; similarly, a player must beat a chapter on Elite mode before they unlock Hero mode for that chapter.

children.name: Arena
children.description:
Battle - Arena 
You can challenge other players in the Arena and reach higher ranks. Winning in Arena grants Development Energon, and other rewards depending on your rank.

children.name: Ability Compete
children.description:
Battle - Ability Compete
Challenge other players of the same level for ability fragments. Number of times you can compete are limited to daily. 

Fuse
After you get the required number of ability fragments, you can fuse them together to create a powerful ability.

children.name: Combiner Raid
children.description:
Battle - Combiner Raid 
Different stages of Combiner Raid can are unlocked as you Commander's level increases. 

Attack the Combiners to get their Cyberkeys.

children.name: Trial
children.description:
Battle - Trial 
Use Trial mode to acquire Starmetal. Trial has five separate stages, and players can challenge them a certain number of times each day.

children.name: World Boss
children.description:
Battle - World Boss
Commanders from all over the world come together and challenge Quintesson Judge, the world boss. Defeating Quintesson gives players rewards based on their performance in the battle. Quintesson will be available at certain times every day.

children.name: Tower
children.description:
Battle - Tower 
Challenge increasingly difficult levels of the Tower to acquire Tech Energon and credits. Get as high as you can everyday. You can sweep the Tower the next day, which will automatically fight each floor you beat the previous day, and give you the associated rewards. 

Tower Refresh 
Tower refreshes every day. You can also use Cybertickets to refresh the tower.

children.name: Daily Login
children.description:
Event - Daily Login 
You can get daily bonuses by logging onto the game every day for a month. The more days you login within a month will give you better rewards. Daily login bonuses will also reset every month.

children.name: Gift Code
children.description:
Event - Gift Code
You can input gift codes from various events to get rewards.

children.name: Novice 7 Days
children.description:
Event - Novice 7 Days 
Newcomers to the game can claim additional rewards each day for seven days.

children.name: Recharging Chamber
children.description:
Event - Recharging Chamber 
Recharging Chamber will be open twice a day. You can recharge your character to regain Energon (Action Points).

children.name: Limit Event
children.description:
Event - Limit Event 
There will be some limited events in the game. Don't forget to take part in them.

children.name: Monthly Card
children.description:
Event - Monthly Card
If you buy a monthly card, you will receive a value pack, and VIP Privelage. You will also get Cybertickets every day for 30 days.

children.name: Cyberboost
children.description:
Event - Cyberboost
The highest ranked Commander of the winning side of Armageddon will become the new Blesser. The Blesser can bless for free one time every day, and claim the Cyberkey of the blessing card. The Blesser can also use space tickets to increase the number of daily blessings and get more Cyberkeys.

children.name: Ally
children.description:
Social - Ally 
Use the Ally function to make friends with other Commanders.

children.name: Union
children.description:
Social - Union 
You can join up with other players and form a Union.

children.name: Message
children.description:
Social - Message
There are four kinds of messages that can be delivered into your message box: System, Battle Report, Ally, and Comment.

children.name: Chat
children.description:
Social - Chat 
You can use the Chat Cannon to send messages to players across the server. Each message costs one Chat Cannon.

children.name: Leaderboard
children.description:
Social - Leaderboard 
All users will be ranked by level and by their power. Players who have reached level 10 will be ranked in the level board. Players who have power over 9,000 will be ranked on the power board.

children.name: Invitation
children.description:
Social - Invitation 
You

children.name: Space Bridge
children.description:
Shop - Space Bridge 
You can acquire new character cards by activating the Space Bridge. There are three different character card levels you can choose from. 

Free Activate
You can activate the Space Bridge for free by waiting to the timer to reach zero.

children.name: Item Shop
children.description:
Shop - Item Shop 
You can use Cyberkeys to buy various items in the Item shop.

children.name: Charge
children.description:
Shop - Charge 
You can use Cybertickets to Charge your account and increase VIP level.

children.name: VIP
children.description:
Shop - VIP 
VIP levels are increased by using the Charge feature. 

VIP Privilege 
Higher VIP level grants additional rewards.

children.name: Black Market
children.description:
Shop - Black Market 
You can use Dark Cyberkeys to buy goods from the Black Market. 

You can get Dark Cyberkeys by converting your normal Cyberkeys. 

The Black Market is updated regularly, and can be refreshed by the player.
